meaningMnemonic: The <radical>mysterious</radical> sound that comes from a <radical>bow</radical>string when you pluck it is called a <kanji>chord</kanji>. It's still a <kanji>bowstring</kanji> though. You need strings to make chords, after all.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>chord</kanji> you're hearing right now is being played by <reading>Gen</reading>ji (げん). He's sitting under your window plucking bowstrings and singing.
